title: Open-Source Project Learning for Developing 3D Game Engines for Emergency Response Training

context.prior_knowledge: Basic programming comprehension (C++/Python) and foundational game engine/3D graphics concepts
context.additional_context: Corporate job training aimed at strengthening open-source technology utilization skills applicable to practical tasks.

learning_goals: An open-source 3D game engine specialized for emergency response scenarios can be built by combining open-source components
The integration process of physics engines, rendering systems, and interaction modules for virtual environment development can be explained
Interactive content simulating real emergency situations (e.g., fire, rescue) can be designed and implemented

resources: Open-source 3D engine library (Unreal Engine, Godot, etc.)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
